attributes.action: Stop the development of Waxwell Lane Car Park
attributes.additional_details: There is a draft proposal that is currently not being published, however, a copy has been made available on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/StopWaxwellLaneDevelopment/
attributes.background: The London Borough of Harrow are proposing the development of 34 new housing units in Waxwell Lane Car Park. This proposal will have negative impacts such as an increase on: local traffic flow; local residential street parking; demand on local services and the demand on over subscribed school places

rejection.details:
This proposal has been made by your local council and not the UK Government. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are and how to contact them:
 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your council has a petitions process:

http://www.harrow.gov.uk/www2/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx
 
Once an application is made for development to take place, all local residents have the right to request that a planning application be ‘called in’ by the Department for Communities and Local Government. This means that it will assess the planning application against certain criteria and decide if a full inquiry is needed. For more information, including the criteria and how to request the call in of a planning application, see:
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN00930/SN00930.pdf
